channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amtrak's flagship Acela trains get a long-awaited upgrade
item.description: The NextGen Acela trains, as Amtrak calls them, are faster and lighter than the current fleet. They're scheduled to start revenue service along the No...

item.title: Russian Missile and Drone Attack Kills at Least 14 in Kyiv
item.description: The strikes on Ukraine’s capital, nearly two weeks after the U.S.-Russia summit in Alaska, injured at least 45 people, officials said.

item.title: What We Know About the Minneapolis Catholic School Shooting
item.description: Investigators were still searching for a motive in the shooting, which left two children dead at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis.

item.title: What to Know About Jimmy Lai’s Trial in Hong Kong
item.description: The media tycoon, jailed since 2020, ran a now-defunct newspaper that was critical of the government.

item.title: America Was Making Progress on Opioid Addiction. That’s Now at Risk
item.description: Trump’s budget law effectively undoes much of the good that the Affordable Care Act did in reducing opioid deaths.

item.title: The road to famine: How U.S. policy failed Palestinians in Gaza
item.description: As famine plagues Gaza, NPR exclusive reporting looks at the U.S.'s role in the humanitarian crisis. Many former officials NPR interviewed share a com...

item.title: What will the end of the 'de minimis' rule mean for U.S. consumers?
item.description: On Friday, the U.S. is ending its de minimis rule that made it easy for cheap goods to reach consumers. The change will affect roughly 4 million such ...

item.title: These investigators patrol Las Vegas looking for one thing: water waste
item.description: The Southern Nevada Water Authority has investigators who patrol Las Vegas neighborhoods in search of wasted water.

item.title: Disney World Is the Happiest Place on Earth, if You Can Afford It
item.description: The theme-park operator, like so many other companies, is abandoning America’s middle class.

item.title: Speaker Johnson slashed Medicaid. His constituents could lose health services
item.description: In Mike Johnson's district, not only could thousands of Louisianians lose coverage, health centers are bracing for a financial hit. They're hoping for...

item.title: Israel’s Exhausted Soldiers Complicate Plans for Gaza Assault
item.description: Worn down by hundreds of days of military service, fewer Israeli reservists are turning up for duty. Others are refusing to fight in a war they no lon...

item.description: The strikes on Ukraine’s capital, nearly two weeks after the U.S.-Russia summit in Alaska, injured at least 45 people, officials said.

item.description: The media tycoon, jailed since 2020, ran a now-defunct newspaper that was critical of the government.

item.title: Steven Cook, a Former Chemical Industry Lawyer, Now at E.P.A., Wants to Change PFAS Rules
item.description: A Trump appointee has proposed rewriting a measure that requires companies to clean up “forever chemicals,” documents show. The new version would shif...

item.title: Looted by Nazis, a 17th-Century Painting Resurfaces. But Not for Long.
item.description: The artwork had been missing for 80 years before Dutch journalists spotted it in a real estate listing in Argentina.
